verses.roman:
'aṁśa' nā kahiyā, kene kaha tāṅre 'aṅga'
'aṁśa' haite 'aṅga,' yāte haya antaraṅga

synonyms: aṁśa—part; nā kahiyā—not saying; kene—why; kaha—you say; tāṅre—Him; aṅga—limb; aṁśa haite—than a part; aṅga—limb; yāte—because; haya—is; antaraṅga—more.
translation: Why has Śrī Advaita been called a limb and not a part? The reason is that "limb" implies greater intimacy.
